com.phunware.core

Class CoreModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.phunware.core.CoreModule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CMEModule, PwAnalyticsModule, PwCoreModule

    public abstract class CoreModule
extends Object
    Intended to be extended by any main class of a module. Any class extending this should have a default constructor and call the super constructor to properly initialize the module.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CoreModule(String packageName, String moduleVersionCode, String coreRequiredVersion, PwCoreSession.Environment builtFor)
      Initialize and attach to MaaS Core.

        protected void onSessionReady()

      • onCoreInitialized

        protected void onCoreInitialized(android.content.Context context,
                                 boolean freshInstall,
                                 boolean appIsUpdated)
        Called as soon as MaaS Core has been initialized (i.e. at the end of PwCoreSession.registerKeys(android.content.Context, String, String, String, String)).
        Parameters:
        context - The application context.
        freshInstall - True if this is a fresh installation of the app, false if not.
        appIsUpdated - True if this is the first run after updating an app, false if not.

      • onReceive

        protected void onReceive(android.content.Context context,
                         android.content.Intent intent)
        This method is called when the BroadcastReceiver is receiving an Intent broadcast. During this time, you can use the other methods on BroadcastReceiver to view or modify the current result values. This method is always called within the main thread of its process.
        Parameters:
        context - The context the receiver is running in.
        intent - The intent being received.

      • getInstalledVersionCode

        public String getInstalledVersionCode()
        Get the version code for the installed version.
        Returns:
        The version code (ex. "1.0.0").

      • getCoreVersionRequirement

        public String getCoreVersionRequirement()
        Each module requires the Core SDK to be a specific version. This will return the version required.
        Returns:
        The version code required of Core SDK (ex. "1.0.0").

      • isModuleUpdated

        public boolean isModuleUpdated()
        Check if the module is being updated.
        Returns:
        True if the module is starting from an update.

      • isFreshModuleInstall

        public boolean isFreshModuleInstall()
        Check if the module has started from a fresh installation.
        Returns:
        True if the module is on a fresh install, false if not.
